com.meteorcode.pathway.model

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meteorcode.pathway.model.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents a 2D grid of Tiles, which may be occupied by Entities, with an associated Context for evaluating scripts.

    Grids modeled by this class are backed by a two-dimensional array of Tiles with a specified size. This is to make performing basic grid operations (such as getTileAt(x,y)) fast. Note, however, that this means that the Grid will always take up the same amount of space in RAM, even if most of the coordinate pairs are unused. If your game's needs would be better suited by a sparse grid, consider extending this class with a new Grid implementation backed by a linked list or (if you're really ambitious) a sparse array implementation. This also means means that a Grid cannot grow in size once it has been created. If you need that functionality for your game, and are willing to sacrifice a significantly slower access time, a new Grid implementation backed by a linked list might be your best bet. Finally, note that all Grids are square. If you really, really need rectangular grids, I suggest you write your own rectangular grid implementation.

    If you actually take my advice and write a new Grid implementation, please be sure to make a pull request on the GitHub repository for Pathway. And, if you need help or want to discuss Pathway's grid system, you can contact me at hawk@meteorcode.com.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(int size,
    java.lang.String name)
        Constructor for a Grid with it's own Context.

        A new Context will be created for this grid automatically.

        Parameters:
        size - an integer specifying the size of the grid in the x/y dimension
        name - this Grid's name.

      • Grid

        public Grid(int size)
        Constructor for a Grid with its' own Context and the default name.

        A new Context will be created for this Grid automatically, and the name will be set to the class name (Grid, if this Grid is a grid, or the name of the extending class if this is an instance of some class that extends Grid).

        Parameters:
        size - an integer specifying the size of the grid in the x/y dimension

      • Grid

        public Grid(int size,
    java.lang.String name,
    Context context)
        Constructor to attach a Grid to an existing Context.
        Parameters:
        size - an integer specifying the size of the grid in the x/y dimension
        name - this Grid's name
        context - the scripting context which contains this Grid
